IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The Foundation is committed to supporting youth, athletics, education, and the communities in which Foot Locker, Inc. has operations.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Foundation is committed to supporting youth, athletics, education, and the communities in which Foot Locker, Inc. has operations.
IRS990.Desc: Foot Locker Scholar Athletes program awards nineteen $5,000 and one $6,250 scholarships per year for four years to high school seniors who demonstrate academic excellence and exemplify strong leadership skills both in sports and within their communities. The Foundation also awards nineteen $5,000 and one $10,000 scholarships to employees of Foot Locker, Inc. and its subsidiaries. The criteria for awarding these scholarships is the same as for the external programs but further limited by the guidelines in Rev. Proc. 76-47. Officers and directors (and their children) of the Foundation or of Foot Locker, Inc. are not eligible for the internal program. In 2020, the Foundation established a new scholarship program benefiting ten FLI black team members with scholarships of $5,000 each which is managed by a third party. The Foundation has also established a scholarship through the Champs Sports Foundation which awards twelve one-year scholarships of $2,500.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: The Foot Locker Foundation makes grants to other 501(c)(3) organizations. The largest grants in 2022 were to the Local Initiatives Support Corporation and Laureus Sport for Good Foundation as detailed on Schedule I, Part II.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Net income for prior years were from fundraising events, then was no events in 2020 and 2021 due to the COVID pandemic. The event resumed in 2022.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part X, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: U.S. generally accepted accounting principles require the Foundation to evaluate tax positions taken by the Foundation and recognize a tax liability (or asset) if the plan has taken an uncertain position that more likely than not would not be sustained upon examination by the Internal Revenue Service. The Foundation has analyzed the tax positions taken, and has concluded that as of January 28, 2023 and January 29, 2022 there were no uncertain positions taken or expected to be taken that would require recognition of a liability (or asset) or disclosure in the financial statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part XI, Line 2d
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Gross revenue from fundraising event

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part XI, Line 4b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Net loss from fundraising event

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule D, Part XII, Line 2d
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Direct expenses for fundraising events

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation engages a third party Do Something to develop and manage the scholarship process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule I, Part II, Line 1
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: LISC Foundation Funding $1,750,000, Laureus Sport for Good Foundation $800,000, United Negro College Fund $310,000, Two Ten Footwear Foundation, Inc. $100,000, International Rescue Committee $100,000 and Police Athletic League of Manatee County $25,000.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: 1) Frank Bracken - Stock Awards $2,485,048, Option Awards $260,010 : all from Foot Locker, Inc.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 5
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Bonus and LTIP are contingent on the Company's performance

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Schedule J, Part I, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Bonus and LTIP are contingent on the Company's performance

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All of the officers and directors of the Foundation are employees of Foot Locker, Inc.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All the Directors of the Foundation are selected by senior officers of Foot Locker, Inc.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 8a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board minutes are prepared annually. Committee minutes are prepaid monthly.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All directors sign and review the audited financial statements of the Foundation. Then they require the responsible tax officer of the Foundation to prepare the Form 990 in a manner consistent with those financial statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The officers and directors of the Foundation are all employees of Foot Locker, Inc. and are all bound by the Foot Locker, Inc. Code of Conduct. Each officer and director must review the policy every year and certify that they are in compliance with it.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 13
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation's directors and officers are all bound by the code of conduct and document retention policies of Foot Locker, Inc.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 14
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation's directors and officers are all bound by the code of conduct and document retention policies of Foot Locker, Inc

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: No director or officer receives any compensation from the Foundation and the Foundation has no employees.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation's governing documents, conflicts of interest policy, and financial statements are available to the public upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VII, Section A, Line 1a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Various - information for officers and directors are available upon request.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part IX, Line 11g
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Scholarship consulting expenses and related expenses $99,249, direct allocated expenses $54,067 and directed unallocated expenses $59,756.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: Form 8868 for tax year 2022 was filed for the Foot Locker Foundation, Inc. and accepted on 6/12/2023.
